content.raw:
Can we reorient the `some_collide` links to illustrate which ones are colliding with each other? (this matches the `collide_bitmask.world` orientation)

~~~
diff -r 11726e708b5e test/worlds/model_self_collide.world
--- a/test/worlds/model_self_collide.world	Thu Mar 05 10:24:23 2015 -0800
+++ b/test/worlds/model_self_collide.world	Thu Mar 05 14:07:52 2015 -0800
@@ -133,7 +133,7 @@
       </link>
 
       <link name="link1">
-        <pose>0 0 3.0 0 0 0</pose>
+        <pose>-1.5 1.5 3.0 0 0 1.57</pose>
         <self_collide>false</self_collide>
         <inertial>
           <mass>1</mass>
@@ -163,7 +163,7 @@
       </link>
 
       <link name="link2">
-        <pose>0 0 6.0 0 0 0</pose>
+        <pose>0 1.5 6.0 0 0 2.24</pose>
         <inertial>
           <mass>1</mass>
           <inertia>
~~~
content.html:
Can we reorient the some_collide links to illustrate which ones are colliding with each other? (this matches the collide_bitmask.world orientation)

diff -r 11726e708b5e test/worlds/model_self_collide.world
--- a/test/worlds/model_self_collide.world  Thu Mar 05 10:24:23 2015 -0800
+++ b/test/worlds/model_self_collide.world  Thu Mar 05 14:07:52 2015 -0800
@@ -133,7 +133,7 @@
       </link>

       <link name="link1">
-        <pose>0 0 3.0 0 0 0</pose>
+        <pose>-1.5 1.5 3.0 0 0 1.57</pose>
         <self_collide>false</self_collide>
         <inertial>
           <mass>1</mass>
@@ -163,7 +163,7 @@
       </link>

       <link name="link2">
-        <pose>0 0 6.0 0 0 0</pose>
+        <pose>0 1.5 6.0 0 0 2.24</pose>
         <inertial>
           <mass>1</mass>
           <inertia>
